title: Emami shares surge 9% post Q3 earnings as PAT grows 15% YoY, Rs 6/share dividend announcement
summary: Emami shares rose sharply after the FMCG major reported a 15% YoY rise in Q3 net profit to Rs 319 crore and a 10% revenue increase. Strong gross margins, improved EBITDA, resilient rural demand and a favourable winter boosted performance. The company also announced a second interim dividend of Rs 6 per share.

title: 9 stocks with rising EPS over four quarters. Do you own any?
summary: Nine companies from the Nifty500 universe have posted consistent quarter-on-quarter growth in earnings per share up to the December 2025 quarter, indicating improving profitability and operational efficiency. Stocks such as IIFL Finance, Shriram Finance, Craftsman Automation and Solar Industries India stood out in the StockEdge profitability scan.

title: Tata Motors PV Q3 Preview: JLR hit to weigh on profits; revenue may slip up to 9% despite festive, GST tailwinds
summary: Tata Motors PV Q3FY26 may show resilient India passenger vehicle demand but weak consolidated results as Jaguar Land Rover faces production disruption and margin stress after a cyber-attack, with most brokerages forecasting revenue decline and losses despite steady domestic volumes.

title: Sensex rises 79 points, Nifty 50 ends at 25,776— 10 key highlights from the Indian stock market today
summary: Sensex rose 79 points, or 0.09%, to end at 83,817.69, while the Nifty 50 ended at 25,776, up 48 points, or 0.19%. The BSE 150 MidCap Index 0.61%, while the BSE 250 SmallCap Index rose 0.54%.

title: 1100% rally in five years! Multibagger stock rises 10% following stock market rebound
summary: Multibagger stock: Shanti Educational Initiatives' share price opened unchanged at  ₹147.85 apiece on Wednesday, and soon touched the 10% upper price band of  ₹162.60.

title: Top Gainers & Losers on Feb 04: Infosys, TCS, Coforge, HAL, HCL Tech, Wipro, Vardhman Textiles among top losers
summary: The Indian stock market continued its bull run on February 4, with Nifty 50 up 0.22% and S&amp;P Sensex up 0.12%. Tech stocks faced heavy losses, particularly the Nifty IT index which dropped 6%, while broader markets outperformed with Nifty Midcap 100 and Smallcap 100 gains.

title: Bajaj Finance is sacrificing immediate profits for long-term safety. Will it succeed?
summary: With traditional growth engines beginning to sputter, the lender is betting on a fortress balance sheet to navigate a more crowded and cautious credit market.

title: Yuan vs dollar: Can Chinese yuan dethrone US dollar as world’s reserve currency? Peter Schiff explains
summary: On whether China can truly challenge the dollar, Schiff was clear: the process is already underway. Central banks have been steadily increasing gold reserves while reducing exposure to US Treasuries, making gold — not the dollar — the world’s largest reserve asset.

title: India-US trade deal sparks  ₹5,400 crore FII buying — Can this trend sustain in February?
summary: According to the data available on NSDL, FIIs bought shares worth  ₹5,426 crore; meanwhile, DIIs also purchased shares worth  ₹345 crore on February 3. If FIIs remain net buyers by the end of February, it will mark the first month since October of foreign inflows.

title: Here's how the top H-1B sponsor is turning to India as Trump tightens visa rules
summary: The expansion plan comes amid tighter US immigration policies under Donald Trump. In January this year, Washington announced an indefinite pause on immigrant visa processing for applicants from 75 countries.

title: Sebi mulls overhaul of 'fit and proper person' framework governing market intermediaries
summary: Sebi has proposed a major revamp of its ‘fit and proper person’ framework to enhance clarity, fairness and reduce regulatory uncertainty. Key changes include codifying the right to a hearing, narrowing disqualifications, easing ineligibility norms, redefining group-entity impact, and limiting voting rights instead of forcing divestment by persons in control.

title: Some obvious & some not so obvious: 8 stocks from 4 different sectors where US business matters
summary: Tariffs don’t hit a company only as a “tax”. They hit as uncertainty and equity markets punish uncertainty faster than they punish a one-time cost. That’s why stocks with meaningful US exposure had been under pressure since the time the issue of the tariff started last year.

title: Brandman Retail IPO booked 69% on Day 1; NIIs steal the show. Check GMP, issue details, more
summary: Brandman Retail IPO, running from February 4 to February 6, is priced at  ₹167-176 per share. The company, founded in 2021, aims to enhance its retail footprint and working capital with the proceeds from the offering.

title: Fiscal realism and RBI patience: The new playbook for Indian bond investors
summary: A well-constructed accrual-oriented portfolio that blends high-quality core holdings with measured doses of high-yield credit can potentially deliver superior risk-adjusted returns even in a flat yield environment.

title: The Great Resignation to IT job losses: Deepak Shenoy has this suggestion to shivering IT stocks on AI fear
summary: Amid a downturn in Indian IT stocks linked to AI fears, CEO Deepak Shenoy advocates for viewing AI as an opportunity for adaptation and reskilling. He warns that efficiency and skill relevance will be key as the industry evolves.

title: MCX gold rate today reclaims  ₹1,60,000 mark. How much gold should you hold in your portfolio?
summary: MCX gold April futures reclaimed the  ₹160,000 mark today, rising as much as 4.5% over its last close, reversing course following a steep correction last week, as a weak US dollar and lower-level buying emerged.

title: IndiGo reduces Manchester, London flights, to suspend Copenhagen services - check schedule here
summary: IndiGo in a statement released on Wednesday announced the revised schedule for its long-haul flights, cutting services for Copenhagen, Manchester and London sectors. Here's the full revised schedule

title: With two partnerships in two weeks, Adani ramps up defence push
summary: Adani Group is aggressively accelerating its bid to strengthen its presence in the Indian defence sector, securing its second major international aerospace partnership in just two weeks.

title: Byju’s resolution professional aims at Raveendran Singapore firm in Aakash control battle
summary: As Byju's navigates a bankruptcy resolution, the spotlight is back on Beeaar, a Singapore firm owned by promoter Byju Raveendran. The resolution professional has alleged Beeaar's directors acted in a way that shareholder structures and covenants in Aakash Educational Services were violated.

title: Gold, silver or stocks? How Mukesh Ambani believes average Indian saver can compound wealth
summary: Mukesh Ambani urged Indians to shift savings from gold and silver into capital markets, arguing that precious metals, though safe, do not create wealth in a fast-growing economy. Speaking at a JioBlackRock event, he said productive investments offer compounding returns, unlike bullion imports that sit idle outside the formal financial system.

title: Carlsberg shares rise as profit beats forecasts; co mulls Indian IPO
summary: Carlsberg reported a 5% rise in full-year operating profit, exceeding forecasts, and is considering an initial public offering for its Indian operations. The brewer also projected 2-6% profit growth for the current year, despite a challenging consumer environment. The potential Indian IPO could significantly reduce the company's debt.

title: 'Idle money in bank accounts doesn't compound': Mukesh Ambani on why Indians should invest in stock market
summary: Mukesh Ambani urged Indian households to shift savings from physical assets like gold to capital markets for productive wealth creation. He emphasized simplifying investment access, drawing a parallel to Jio's impact, to democratize participation and fuel economic growth as India enters a powerful expansion phase.

title: Next 20-25 years will be India's era: Blackrock CEO on why the world's biggest asset manager is betting big on Indian investors
summary: BlackRock CEO Larry Fink said the next 20–25 years will be the “era of India,” driven by rising domestic investment and rapid technological adoption. Speaking with Mukesh Ambani at a JioBlackRock event, he highlighted deeper household participation in markets and India’s growing role as a core pillar of BlackRock’s long-term strategy.

title: Gainers & Losers: Infosys, Eternal & Gokaldas Exports among 7 big movers on Wednesday
summary: Nifty ended at 25,776, gaining 48.45 points or 0.19%, the BSE Sensex surged 78.56 points or 0.09% to Rs 83,817.69.

title: US stock futures point to flat start for Wall Street after Anthropic AI-led tech selloff
summary: The latest selloff in tech stocks was sparked by Anthropic after it said it was launching a new artificial intelligence (AI) tool servicing legal work, threatening software firms.

title: Tata Power Q3 results: Profit remains flat at  ₹1,194 crore, revenue falls 4% YoY
summary: Tata Power Q3 results: Profit remained flat at  ₹1,194 crore, while revenue from operations for the quarter dropped 4% YoY to  ₹14,485 crore.

title: Grover Jewells IPO Day 1: Latest GMP, subscription status, listing date & other details about SME issue
summary: Grover Jewells' IPO, which opened on January 28, was fully subscribed at 1.08 times, with strong interest from non-institutional and retail investors. The company aims to raise  ₹33.83 crore, with a price band of  ₹83 to  ₹88 per share.

title: Today, the AI story is not well understood in the Indian market: Fractal CEO
summary: There's a huge need to just educate the market on AI because there are not a lot of AI stocks out there, says Fractal Analytics' founder Srikanth Velamakanni.

summary: Multi-asset funds provide portfolio diversification by investing in different asset classes. Recent have led fund managers to adjust allocations. Investors should consider funds that align with their risk tolerance.

summary: Before chasing the white metal’s rise, investors should take note of its past.

title: Shankar Sharma on the Indian stock market: Why medium-term returns may stay moderate
summary: Ace investor Shankar Sharma believes that the Indian stock market may deliver moderate returns in the medium term. With a lack of fresh triggers and macroeconomic concerns, Sharma emphasises the need for cautious expectations despite a promising long-term outlook.

title: Sebi proposes overhaul of ‘fit and proper’ test for market intermediaries
summary: The markets regulator has proposed doing away with automatic disqualifications over pending criminal complaints and charge sheets, saying these rules risk penalizing individuals and firms before wrongdoing is established.

title: Marico to acquire 60% stake in Cosmix Wellness for nearly  ₹226 crore — What investors should know
summary: Marico will acquire a 60% stake in the food and nutrition company Cosmix Wellness for a consideration of  ₹226 crore as the FMCG giant aims to expand its presence in premium food and nutrition categories. Here's what investors should know.

title: Market Trading Guide: Buy Blue Star and Kirloskar Oil on Thursday for up to 5% short term gains
summary: Nifty closed higher for a second consecutive day, despite IT sector weakness, as other sectors gained momentum. Analysts noted initial market hesitation followed by a recovery, indicating buying interest at lower levels. Immediate resistance is seen at 25,900-25,950, with support at 25,600-25,650.

title: These mid-cap stocks with ‘Strong Buy’ & ‘Buy’ recos can rally over 25%, according to analysts
summary: An uncertainty troubling the stock market for long (the India-US trade deal) has been taken care of. So, the chances are that, once the valuation and growth equation gets resolved, we might see the bulls making another comeback attempt. There has been some correction in terms of valuations, which means even mid-cap have a higher probability of getting the street’s attention.

title: ET Prime Special Series: Multibagger or IBC - Part 44: EV-agnostic products, but does this auto ancillary have the capacity to grow?
summary: The story here is less about diversification and more about execution within a single product line. This is a business shaped by its origins as a demerged manufacturing unit rather than a greenfield entrant. Operating entirely in India, the company supplies its products to two-wheeler and passenger vehicle manufacturers. Capacity is largely utilised, leaving little room for volume upside without fresh investment. Audit disclosures add nuance through a pricing-related observation in a related-party transaction, even as the main opinion remains unqualified. As the auto sector shifts technologies, the company’s disclosures suggest product relevance continues, but without a clearly articulated growth roadmap tied to EV platforms.

title: Sebi modifies Order-to-Trade Ratio framework for algorithmic trading. Key changes explained
summary: Sebi is refining its Order-to-Trade Ratio framework for algorithmic orders, effective April 6, 2026. New exemptions for equity options and specific price bands aim to balance market liquidity with preventing excessive order placement. These changes follow stakeholder input and acknowledge the role of market makers. Separately, Sebi proposed overhauling its 'fit and proper person' rules for intermediaries.

title: US stock market: Wall Street opens mixed amid investor caution after tech-led sell-off
summary: The US stock market opened mixed on 4 February, following a tech rout that caused significant losses. The Nasdaq fell another 0.4%, while Advanced Micro Devices and Chipotle faced declines. Investors are focused on upcoming labour market data and earnings reports from major tech firms.

title: US Stock Market LIVE Updates: Dow Jones, S&P 500 open higher; Nasdaq falls as investors avoid tech stock bets
summary: US Stock Market Today LIVE: US stock market indices like the Dow Jones and the S&P 500 opened higher, while the Nasdaq Composite dropped as investors avoid big bets on software and cloud stocks. Follow all US stock market live updates here.

title: Uber shares in focus as Q4 revenue jumps 20%, led by food delivery; Q1 growth forecast weaker
summary: Uber reported Q4 profit missed estimates and Q1 forecast was below expectations. Despite a revenue increase to $14.37 billion, net income dropped sharply to $296 million, influenced by equity investment revaluation. The company also announced a change in finance leadership.

title: India is the largest private equity destination for us outside the US: Chip Kaye, chairman, Warburg Pincus
summary: Kaye and Jeffrey Perlman, the firm’s CEO, along with other senior management, are in India to celebrate their 30-year investing journey. Starting with backing entrepreneurs and businesses such as Sunil Mittal, HDFC, IDFC, among others, the firm has, over the last three decades, backed 80 companies.

title: Pizza Hut reset in focus as Devyani International appoints new CEO
summary: Manish Dawar, the incoming president and chief executive, said Devyani International will add zero net new Pizza Hut outlets in 2026, shifting attention instead to fixing the fundamentals.

title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock market action on Thursday
summary: Indian stock markets extended gains for a second day. The Nifty and Sensex closed higher, buoyed by optimism around a potential India-US trade deal. Most sectors saw gains, offsetting weakness in IT stocks. Analysts suggest consolidation is healthy, with key support and resistance levels identified. Several stocks showed buying interest, while others faced selling pressure.

summary: Our technical analysts identify select stocks that may gain momentum even in volatile markets. Here are the technical calls for today.

summary: Gold and silver saw significant gains as safe-haven demand grew amid geopolitical tensions. Comex gold futures increased by 3.6% to $5,113, and silver futures rose 10.44% to $92 per troy ounce.

title: Emcure taps into celebrities for its weight loss drug, as marketing playbooks change
summary: The Pune-based company is employing a user-first approach, going beyond healthcare providers, as weight-loss drugs continue to attract greater patient interest, signalling a shift in marketing strategies for domestic drugmakers.

title: Cognizant scripts turnaround with fastest growth in four years
summary: With better-than-expected growth, Cognizant exceeds its own guidance of 6.6-6.9% full-year growth, set in October 2025.

title: Societe Generale enters Gokaldas Exports with Rs 41 cr bulk deal as stock rallies 43%
summary: Gokaldas Exports saw a significant bulk deal as Societe Generale purchased over 5 lakh shares worth Rs 41 crore. The apparel manufacturer's stock has surged 43% in two days, benefiting from a US-India trade deal that slashes tariffs on Indian goods. Despite recent gains, the stock remains down 14% year-to-date.

title: NSDL glitch stalls trade settlement for several investors
summary: Shares or funds for trades ordered on Tuesday were yet to be credited to clients' accounts till late on Wednesday night.
